UNIVERSITY OF CAMBRIDGE INTERNATIONAL EXAMINATIONS

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[210, 114, 477, 128]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[210, 129, 613, 144]]<|/det|>
Advanced Subsidiary Level and Advanced Level

<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 195, 220, 207]]<|/det|>
# MATHEMATICS

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[836, 195, 907, 207]]<|/det|>
9709/11

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 217, 358, 231]]<|/det|>
Paper 1 Pure Mathematics 1 (P1)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[784, 217, 907, 231]]<|/det|>
May/June 2013

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[759, 240, 907, 253]]<|/det|>
1 hour 45 minutes

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 260, 455, 274]]<|/det|>
Additional Materials: Answer Booklet/Paper

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[282, 273, 390, 287]]<|/det|>
Graph Paper

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[282, 287, 460, 301]]<|/det|>
List of Formulae (MF9)

<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 322, 390, 336]]<|/det|>
# READ THESE INSTRUCTIONS FIRST

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 352, 828, 366]]<|/det|>
If you have been given an Answer Booklet, follow the instructions on the front cover of the Booklet.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 368, 722, 383]]<|/det|>
Write your Centre number, candidate number and name on all the work you hand in.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 384, 327, 399]]<|/det|>
Write in dark blue or black pen.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 400, 497, 415]]<|/det|>
You may use a soft pencil for any diagrams or graphs.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 416, 601, 431]]<|/det|>
Do not use staples, paper clips, highlighters, glue or correction fluid.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 448, 285, 462]]<|/det|>
Answer **all** the questions.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 463, 907, 492]]<|/det|>
Give non-exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place in the case of angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 494, 589, 508]]<|/det|>
The use of an electronic calculator is expected, where appropriate.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 509, 606, 524]]<|/det|>
You are reminded of the need for clear presentation in your answers.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 540, 606, 554]]<|/det|>
At the end of the examination, fasten all your work securely together.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 556, 756, 571]]<|/det|>
The number of marks is given in brackets [ ] at the end of each question or part question.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 572, 440, 587]]<|/det|>
The total number of marks for this paper is 75.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 588, 907, 618]]<|/det|>
Questions carrying smaller numbers of marks are printed earlier in the paper, and questions carrying larger numbers of marks later in the paper.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[339, 865, 660, 879]]<|/det|>
This document consists of 4 printed pages.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 97, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 73, 781, 92]]<|/det|>
It is given that \(\mathrm{f}(x) = (2x - 5)^3 + x\), for \(x \in \mathbb{R}\). Show that f is an increasing function.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 73, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 121, 96, 140]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[128, 121, 920, 155]]<|/det|>
(i) In the expression \((1 - px)^6\), \(p\) is a non-zero constant. Find the first three terms when \((1 - px)^6\) is expanded in ascending powers of \(x\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 138, 920, 156]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 168, 156, 186]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 166, 920, 203]]<|/det|>
It is given that the coefficient of \(x^{2}\) in the expansion of \((1 - x)(1 - px)^{6}\) is zero. Find the value of \(p\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 186, 920, 203]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 230, 96, 247]]<|/det|>
<label>3</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[349, 240, 685, 410]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 426, 920, 476]]<|/det|>
In the diagram, \(OAB\) is a sector of a circle with centre \(O\) and radius \(8\mathrm{cm}\). Angle \(BOA\) is \(\alpha\) radians. \(OAC\) is a semicircle with diameter \(OA\). The area of the semicircle \(OAC\) is twice the area of the sector \(OAB\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[128, 490, 154, 508]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 490, 326, 508]]<|/det|>
Find \(\alpha\) in terms of \(\pi\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 490, 920, 508]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 521, 153, 539]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 521, 599, 539]]<|/det|>
Find the perimeter of the complete figure in terms of \(\pi\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 521, 920, 539]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 567, 96, 586]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 567, 759, 586]]<|/det|>
The third term of a geometric progression is \(- 108\) and the sixth term is 32. Find

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[128, 593, 306, 611]]<|/det|>
the common ratio,

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 593, 920, 611]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 619, 153, 636]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 619, 269, 636]]<|/det|>
the first term,

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 618, 920, 636]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 644, 311, 662]]<|/det|>
<label>(iii)</label> the sum to infinity.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 644, 920, 662]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 695, 94, 714]]<|/det|>
<label>5</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 692, 151, 712]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 692, 292, 712]]<|/det|>
Show that \(\frac{\sin \theta}{\sin \theta + \cos \theta} + \frac{\cos \theta}{\sin \theta - \cos \theta} \equiv \frac{1}{\sin^2 \theta - \cos^2 \theta}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 695, 920, 714]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 734, 151, 755]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 733, 776, 768]]<|/det|>
Hence solve the equation \(\frac{\sin \theta}{\sin \theta + \cos \theta} + \frac{\cos \theta}{\sin \theta - \cos \theta} = 3\), for \(0^\circ \leqslant \theta \leqslant 360^\circ\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 739, 920, 758]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 97, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>6</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 72, 794, 92]]<|/det|>
Relative to an origin \(O\), the position vectors of three points, \(A\), \(B\) and \(C\), are given by

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[196, 100, 801, 123]]<|/det|>
\[\overrightarrow{OA} = \mathbf{i} + 2p\mathbf{j} + q\mathbf{k},\quad \overrightarrow{OB} = q\mathbf{j} - 2p\mathbf{k}\quad \mathrm{and}\quad \overrightarrow{OC} = -(4p^{2} + q^{2})\mathbf{i} + 2p\mathbf{j} + q\mathbf{k},\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 131, 348, 149]]<|/det|>
where \(p\) and \(q\) are constants.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[124, 163, 154, 182]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[160, 161, 737, 183]]<|/det|>
Show that \(\overrightarrow{OA}\) is perpendicular to \(\overrightarrow{OC}\) for all non-zero values of \(p\) and \(q\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 165, 920, 184]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 198, 151, 217]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 196, 531, 217]]<|/det|>
Find the magnitude of \(\overrightarrow{CA}\) in terms of \(p\) and \(q\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 201, 920, 219]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 235, 153, 254]]<|/det|>
<label>(iii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 233, 720, 254]]<|/det|>
For the case where \(p = 3\) and \(q = 2\), find the unit vector parallel to \(\overrightarrow{BA}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 237, 920, 255]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 282, 97, 301]]<|/det|>
<label>7</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 282, 845, 301]]<|/det|>
A curve has equation \(y = x^{2} - 4x + 4\) and a line has equation \(y = mx\), where \(m\) is a constant.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[126, 314, 153, 332]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 314, 920, 348]]<|/det|>
For the case where \(m = 1\), the curve and the line intersect at the points \(A\) and \(B\). Find the coordinates of the mid-point of \(AB\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 361, 153, 378]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 361, 920, 394]]<|/det|>
Find the non-zero value of \(m\) for which the line is a tangent to the curve, and find the coordinates of the point where the tangent touches the curve.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 377, 920, 395]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 421, 96, 441]]<|/det|>
<label>8</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[124, 421, 151, 440]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 421, 798, 441]]<|/det|>
Express \(2x^{2} - 12x + 13\) in the form \(a(x + b)^{2} + c\), where \(a\), \(b\) and \(c\) are constants.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 422, 920, 441]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 454, 153, 473]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 454, 920, 488]]<|/det|>
The function f is defined by \(\operatorname {f}(x) = 2x^{2} - 12x + 13\) for \(x \geqslant k\), where \(k\) is a constant. It is given that f is a one-one function. State the smallest possible value of \(k\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 472, 920, 490]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 501, 406, 520]]<|/det|>
The value of \(k\) is now given to be 7.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 533, 153, 551]]<|/det|>
<label>(iii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 533, 316, 551]]<|/det|>
Find the range of f.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 533, 920, 551]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 564, 151, 583]]<|/det|>
<label>(iv)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 564, 618, 583]]<|/det|>
Find an expression for \(\mathrm{f}^{-1}(x)\) and state the domain of \(\mathrm{f}^{-1}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 564, 920, 583]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 615, 96, 633]]<|/det|>
<label>9</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 613, 677, 633]]<|/det|>
A curve has equation \(y = \operatorname {f}(x)\) and is such that \(\operatorname {f}'(x) = 3x^{\frac{1}{2}} + 3x^{-\frac{1}{2}} - 10\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[128, 650, 156, 668]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[160, 650, 920, 685]]<|/det|>
By using the substitution \(u = x^{\frac{1}{2}}\), or otherwise, find the values of \(x\) for which the curve \(y = \operatorname {f}(x)\) has stationary points.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 668, 920, 687]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 698, 153, 717]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 698, 808, 717]]<|/det|>
Find \(\operatorname {f}''(x)\) and hence, or otherwise, determine the nature of each stationary point.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 698, 920, 717]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 728, 151, 747]]<|/det|>
<label>(iii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 728, 769, 747]]<|/det|>
It is given that the curve \(y = \operatorname {f}(x)\) passes through the point (4, \(- 7\)). Find \(\operatorname {f}(x)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 728, 920, 747]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 104, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>10</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[316, 82, 720, 265]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 285, 920, 320]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows part of the curve \(y = (x - 2)^4\) and the point \(A\) (1, 1) on the curve. The tangent at \(A\) cuts the \(x\)-axis at \(B\) and the normal at \(A\) cuts the \(y\)-axis at \(C\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[126, 333, 154, 351]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 333, 420, 351]]<|/det|>
Find the coordinates of \(B\) and \(C\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 333, 918, 351]]<|/det|>
<mark>[6]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 369, 153, 388]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 364, 845, 390]]<|/det|>
Find the distance \(AC\), giving your answer in the form \(\frac{\sqrt{a}}{b}\), where \(a\) and \(b\) are integers.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 370, 918, 388]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 405, 151, 424]]<|/det|>
<label>(iii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 405, 437, 424]]<|/det|>
Find the area of the shaded region.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 406, 918, 424]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]
